column4: hello, anybody experiencing X crashing on login? I'm running the latest jaunty with Intel i945. If I set Option "NoAccel" "True" it works (obviously without glx). Otherwise I fall back to console with a msg saying that i915_dri.so crashed, libglx.so and libc6.so made smth crash... any ideas?
Is this a new problem or has it done this since install?
new problem. Started happening today, after I updated the sys
Do you remember what you updated?

not everything. But the intel driver was one of them, and I already knew it might give problems. I downgraded it (as i used to do) but this time it still doesnt work. What concerns me is that libc6 was also upgrade...
Just to make sure the upgrade completed completely check that "sudo apt-get -f install" does nothing
it did, already tried that
i already went through google and the forums.. tried everything they said... only this "noaccel" allows me to login
When you downgraded did you downgrade both the intel and xserver packages?
only intel. The others weren't upgraded, I guess
Did you check that the xsever wasn't upgraded? ( look at /var/log/dpkg.log )
yeah, looks like it upgraded xserver-xorg-core
Try downgrading xserver-xorg-core to the version that corrosponds to the xserver-xorg-video-intel package you downgraded
I can't... In order to get X working, I have to use the 2.4 (not the oficial 2.6, shipped with jaunty) of the intel driver, which requires a PPA repository...
Ahh, I thought you meant you downgraded to the previous minor release. Much of the intel regression has been fixed with newer intel drivers. You might try using the X updates PPA
But I don't recommend the crack pushers PPA
yeah, I know... but I'm running out of options here LOL I was hoping this was some known recent problem that wasn't on the forums yet
What version of the intel driver are you currently using?
I'll try the PPA "bleeding edge" 2.7.1 now
jaunty is shipped with 2.6
oops, 2.9
